results.title: PhD candidate 'Development and characterisation of novel malaria transmission blocking vaccine candidates'
results.description: Malaria continues to be one of the most devastating diseases causing almost 500,000 deaths annually. Malaria is caused by the Plasmodium parasite that goes through a multistage life cycle in both man and mosquito. Essential to its life cycle is the transmission of sexual stage parasites (gametocytes) from man to mosquito, where they develop in the midgut to form sporozoites making the mosquito infectious to other humans. Malaria transmission blocking vaccines (TBVs) aim to target sexual stage a…
